data.title: Our new PM must whip No 10 into shape
data.meta_description: Rohan Silva: The first big challenge will be to set up an operation with enough clout to push through policy and deal with Whitehall
data.text:
On the evening of David Cameron’s first day as prime minister in May 2010 I was working late in Downing Street and came across something odd. When you sent an email from a No 10 computer the autocomplete function wasn’t working. So if you wanted to ping someone you had to type out their entire email address every time: the system didn’t automatically fill the address out for you, even if you’d messaged that person before.

I called over to one of the civil servants and asked if he knew how to change this. “Well,” he told me, “you’ll have to wait until the IT team are back in tomorrow, because autocomplete has been switched off for every computer in the building.”

When I asked
